pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:5.1: 51. The training rule on entering monasteries
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.4: At that time a number of monks who were dressed in only one robe were making robes in a village monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.5: Nuns entered the monastery without asking for permission and approached those monks.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.6: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.7: “How can nuns enter a monastery without asking for permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.8: “Is it true, monks, nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.11: How can nuns enter a monastery without asking for permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.12: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:6.13: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:7.2: ‘If a nun enters a monastery without asking for permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:8.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.2: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.3: Even though the nuns knew that the monks had left, they did not go there.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.5: When the nuns knew that this was the case, they asked for permission and then entered that monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.6: They approached the monks and bowed down to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.7: The monks then said to them, “Sisters, why didn’t you sweep the monastery, or put out drinking water or water for washing?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.8: “The Master has laid down a training rule that we may not enter a monastery without asking for permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.9: That’s why we didn’t do it.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.11: “Monks, when a monk is available, a nun should enter a monastery only after asking for permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:9.12: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:10.2: ‘If a nun, when a monk is available, enters a monastery without asking for permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:11.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.2: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery once more, and then returned once again.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.3: Thinking that the monks were still away, the nuns entered the monastery without asking for permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.5: “We have entered a monastery without asking for permission, even though a monk was available. But the Master has laid down a training rule against this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.6: Could it be that we have committed an offense entailing confession?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.8: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:12.9: “And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:13.1: ‘If a nun, knowing that there are monks in a monastery, enters it without asking for permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:14.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:15.2: she knows it by herself or others have told her or they have told her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:16.1: There are monks in a monastery:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:16.2: even where monks stay at the foot of a tree.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:17.1: Enters it without asking for permission:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:17.2: if she goes beyond the boundary of an enclosed monastery without asking permission from a monk or a novice monk or a monastery worker, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:17.3: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:18.1: If there are monks in a monastery, and she perceives that this is so, and she enters it without asking permission from an available monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:18.2: If there are monks in a monastery, but she is unsure if this is so, and she enters it without asking permission from an available monk, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:18.3: If there are monks in a monastery, but she does not perceive that this is so, and she enters it without asking permission from an available monk, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:19.1: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she perceives that there are, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:19.2: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:19.3: If there are no monks in a monastery, and she perceives that there are not, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.2: if she enters after asking permission from an available monk;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.3: if, when there is no available monk, she enters without asking for permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.4: if she goes while looking at the head of a nun in front of her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.5: if she is going to where the nuns have assembled;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.6: if a path goes through the monastery;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:20.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:21.1: The first training rule is finished.
